medical_history.chief_complaint: Failure of LCP condylar plate fixation in distal femoral fractures.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patients had various high-energy traumas leading to distal femoral fractures. Specific cases presented increased pain or deformity several months post-surgery, indicating failure of the fixation device. In Case 1, increased pain occurred at nine months after surgery, leading to the diagnosis of nonunion and implant failure. In Case 2, severe pain and deformity appeared fourteen months post-injury.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Case 3: history of obesity and type-II diabetes mellitus; Case 4: history of obesity and type-II diabetes mellitus; Case 6: long-standing type-I diabetes mellitus and tobacco use. For all other cases, no relevant medical history was specified.
medical_history.social_history: Case 6: tobacco use; for all other cases, social history was not specified.
